intro: Razumovia tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin razumovia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and over-collection.
